tool.name: BuildMosaic

param.name: inMXD
param.dialogReference: The input MXD for folder that contains the rasters that will be loaded into the mosaic dataset.
param.pythonReference: The input MXD for folder that contains the rasters that will be loaded into the mosaic dataset.

param.name: in_workspace
param.dialogReference: The file geodatabase in which the mosaic dataset will be created.
param.pythonReference: The file geodatabase in which the mosaic dataset will be created.

tool.summary: Creates a new mosaic dataset for a weighted overlay service. Loads raster layers and populates fields required for weighted overlay service. Applies key metadata to the mosaic dataset.
tool.usage:
• Applies key metadata to the mosaic dataset. Value is IsWeightedOverlay=True. This is required for use as a weighted overlay service.

  • Run the Configure Raster Fields tool first on each raster you want to load into the mosaic dataset.

scriptExample.title: BuildMosaicDataset Example 1
scriptExample.para: The following code sample demonstrates how to execute the BuildMosaicDataset tool.
scriptExample.code:
# import the toolbox first arcpy.ImportToolbox(r'c:\data\Weighted Raster Overlay Service Tools.pyt')
# script variables inRasters='c:/data/img' inGdb = 'c:/data/physio.gdb' mosaicName='physiographic'
# build the mosaic arcpy.BuildMosaic_wroservice(inRasters,inGdb,mosaicName)

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Creates a new mosaic dataset for a weighted overlay service. Loads raster layers and populates fields required for weighted overlay service. Applies key metadata to the mosaic dataset.
